name: BlogApplication
description: I built a production-ready blog platform using Next.js that showcases advanced full-stack development skills and innovative content management. The application features a custom file-based CMS using Markdown for blog posts, with custom parsing powered by gray-matter and JSX rendering through react-markdown. I developed dynamic routing, implemented server-side rendering and static site generation for optimal performance, and created reusable components including hero sections, navigation systems, post grids, and layouts. The platform integrates MongoDB for contact form submissions through RESTful API routes, utilizes React Portals for UI notifications, and includes custom head management for SEO optimization. I also implemented react-syntax-highlighter for beautiful code snippet rendering within blog posts. This project demonstrates my mastery of modern Next.js architecture, creative problem-solving with Markdown-based content storage, and end-to-end full-stack development from UI design to database integration. Project Link: https://blog-application-gamma-one.vercel.app/

name: Restaurant App
description: Built a responsive and feature-rich restaurant web application using Next.js, MongoDB, and CSS, aimed at helping restaurants manage their online menus and customer interactions. The app offers a smooth user experience with secure sign-up, dynamic menu browsing, and a smart cart system that ensures users can order from only one restaurant at a time. For restaurant owners, the platform includes an intuitive dashboard to update menus in real-time, with the ability to add, edit, or remove food items effortlessly. This project showcases practical full-stack development, user-focused design, and real-time data handling, ideal for modern restaurant operations. Project Link : restaurant-app-six-orpin.vercel.app

name: Event Management & Admin Dashboard System
description: I developed a voluntary event registration and management system for a society, designed to streamline participant registration and attendance tracking. The system includes an admin dashboard where organizers can view and manage attendee details, monitor event attendance in real time, and maintain a centralized participant database. The project was built using Next.js for the frontend and server-side rendering, with MongoDB as the database to store and manage participant information efficiently. Node.js and Express were used for backend APIs and data handling, integrated seamlessly within the Next.js application. This solution improved the societyâ€™s event organization workflow while reducing manual tracking.

name: Shopping Cart App
description: An e-commerce web application built with React.js, Redux, and Tailwind CSS. It features a clean, intuitive user interface with smooth navigation and dynamic cart functionality. Users can browse products, add or remove items, and see real-time price updates without page reloads. The design focuses on simplicity and a seamless shopping experience. Project Link : devnewcode.github.io/my-ecomm/

name: Expense Tracker
description: A simple and efficient web application for tracking income and expenses, built with React.js, Redux, and CSS. It allows users to easily record transactions, categorize them, and maintain a clear overview of their financial activity. Designed with a clean interface for smooth navigation and effortless expense management. Project Link: devnewcode.github.io/expense-tracker/

name: Registration Management System Viplava 2024
description: As a voluntary Full Stack Developer for Viplava 2024, a youth anti-addiction festival organized by ISKCON Youth Forum, I developed a complete registration management system that efficiently handled over 700 registrations. I built a responsive landing page, implemented secure form validation, integrated both online and offline payment options, and created a referral system to boost outreach. Additionally, I automated email confirmations using the Gmail API to streamline communication and reduce manual follow-up. This project allowed me to contribute technically to a meaningful cause, supporting event coordination and improving the overall registration experience.
